content.question: Mia transferred <math alttext="$1,000" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1,000</mtext></math> from her checking account to a certificate of deposit. How will the <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> measures of the money supply change?

choices.label: <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease.

<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.

<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.

<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not change.

<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not change and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.

content.answer: <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not change.

topic.text: 4.3: Definition, Measurement, and Functions of Money

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
